statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.description: Matt Rafferty scored 21 points and hauled in 10 rebounds to propel Furman to a 95-75 win over The Citadel on Thursday night.
article.headline: Furman cruises to 95-75 win over The Citadel
article.linkText: Furman cruises to 95-75 win over The Citadel
article.story: GREENVILLE, S.C. -- Matt Rafferty scored 21 points and hauled in 10 rebounds to propel Furman to a 95-75 win over The Citadel on Thursday night. Stephen Croone added 16 points and Kris Acox had 12 for Furman, which shot 52 percent from the field to get its ninth-straight win at home. The Paladins hit 23 of 29 from the line and controlled the glass 51-37. Leading by a point, Furman (16-11, 10-4 Southern Conference) broke away with a 25-4 run that stretched across both sides of intermission and made it 48-26 with 19:02 to play. Five of the Paladins' eight 3-pointers came during the run, with Croone and Andrew Brown each hitting two and John Davis III capping it with one of his own. The Citadel (10-16, 3-10) scored the game's first five points before being overtaken. Connor Schroeder's 17 points led four Bulldogs in double figures.
